Interface_name: HTTP Client-side by using requests in python
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Python class that implements an HTTP client for interacting with the Pulsstory ExternalSyncAPI, handling authentication, data retrieval, and activity synchronization.

Class Description: The PulsstoryHTTPClient class provides methods to interact with the Pulsstory API, including user authentication, activity download/upload, and token management. It handles HTTP requests, error responses, and data serialization.

Attributes:
- URLBase: str - The base URL for all API endpoints
- PULSSTORY_CLIENT_ID: str - Client ID for API authentication
- PULSSTORY_CLIENT_SECRET: str - Client secret for API authentication

Methods:
- _api_request(endpoint: str, service_record: object = None, method: str = "POST", data: dict = None, headers: dict = None, files: dict = None) -> dict - Internal method to make API requests and handle responses
- _apiData(service_record: object) -> dict - Helper method to prepare authentication data
- get_user_id(service_record: object) -> str - Retrieves user ID from the API
- get_api_uris(service_record: object) -> dict - Gets API endpoint URIs from the service
- retrieve_authorization_token(code: str) -> str - Exchanges an authorization code for an access token
- revoke_authorization(service_record: object) -> None - Revokes an existing authorization
- download_activity(service_record: object, activity_id: str) -> dict - Downloads activity data
- upload_activity(service_record: object, upload_data: dict, uris: dict) -> str - Uploads activity data as a compressed file
